required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intensive Ambulance-delivered Blood Pressure Reduction in Hyper-Acute Stroke Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Intensive Ambulance-delivered Blood Pressure Reduction in Hyper-Acute Stroke Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: The George Institute for Global Health, China

collaborator.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Chengdu Medical College

clinical_study.source: The George Institute for Global Health, China

brief_summary.textblock: A multicentre, ambulance-delivered, prospective, randomized, open-label, blinded endpoint (PROBE) study to assess the effects of hyperacute intensive blood pressure (BP) lowering initiated in ambulance setting on (i) functional outcome in patients with acute stroke (ii) safety in patients with confirmed acute stroke and other conditions that were initially suspected as acute stroke (i.e. stroke mimic).

detailed_description.textblock: As an investigator initiated and conducted, multicentre, ambulance-delivered, prospective, randomised, open-label, blinded outcome (PROBE) study. INTERACT4 aims to evaluate the effects of functional outcome according to an ordinal analysis of the full range of scores on the mRS, the safety in all randomised patients; reperfusion treatment (thrombolysis and/or thrombectomy) related symptomatic ICH (sICH, according to standard definitions), infarct size, the time to and overall rate of reperfusion treatment in AIS patients; hematoma volume and early expansion in ICH.

study_design_info.masking_description: Outcome assessor is independent of the treatment team

primary_outcome.description: Level of function defined across 7 categories of disability on the modified Rankin scale （mRS 0-6) in which scores of 0 or 1 indicate good function without or with symptoms but not disability, socress of 2 indicates slight disability but independence, 3 to 5 indicate increasing levels of disability (and dependency), and a score of 6 indicates death.

secondary_outcome.measure: number of patients with serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: total number of serious adverse events reported during follow-up, according to standard definitions

secondary_outcome.measure: number of patients with any intracranial hemorrhage
secondary_outcome.description: reperfusion treatment (thrombolysis/thrombectomy) related symptomatic intracerebral number of cases of intracranial hemorrhage, according to standard definitions
overall size of cerebral infarction on MRI within 2 days in cases of ischaemic stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: number of patients who receive reperfusion treatment
secondary_outcome.description: total number of cases of reperfusion (thrombolysis and/or thrombectomy) in ischemic stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: time to use of reperfusion treatment
secondary_outcome.description: time from symptom onset to reperfusion treatment in patients with ischemic stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: number of patients with symptomatic intracerebral hemorrhage
secondary_outcome.description: number of cases of symptomatic intracerebral hemorrhage according to standard measure after reperfusion treatment
change in volume of hematoma from baseline to 24 hours, measured on brain imaging

arm_group.description: If systolic blood pressure>180:IV Urapidil 25mg If systolic blood pressure>150 (or 5 mins after first bolus) : IV Urapidil 25mg and to maintain this level after admission to hospital in those with confirmed acute stroke for the next 7 days (or hospital discharge if earlier)

To receive blood pressure management according to standard local guidelines which recommend blood pressure lowering in hospital if systolic level is >220mmHg. This level will be considered by ambulance staff as a threshold for treatment if considered clinically important.

intervention.description: A standard treatment regime based on intravenous (IV) bolus of 25mg urapidil administered over 1 minute. For those patients initial systolic blood pressure 180, another 25mg urapidil bolus will be given if the systolic blood pressure level persists >150 after 5 minutes.

overall_official.affiliation: The George Institute for Global Health, China
The First Affliated Hospital of Chengdu Medical College

facility.name: The George Institute for Global Health
The first affliated hospital of Chengdu medical college

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The George Institute for Global Health, China

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be shared with bona fide researchers after 1 year following conclusion of the study, based on a submitted protocol to the research office of The George Institute for Global Health, Sydney Australia
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: 1 year after conclusion of the study
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: genuine researcher with supporting institution protocol review and approval by the research office of The George Institute
